Fixing terminoloty/actions section in documentation

commit_message:
test_backup_swift: Set volume id per test

Since some of these tests trigger operations (such as
progress reporting) that can happen as an asyncronous
task, set a different ID for each test so it's possible
to identify where notifications are coming from.

Related-Bug: #1501745

Change-Id: I255941ecb813e47ac02c9b8ca09e41d99d12d218

commit_message:
Adding functional tests for SSH actions

 * Added 2 tests: for SSHAction and SSHProxiedAction
 * 2 VMs are created for test purposes

 * SSHProxiedAction test checks that ssh command was
   executed on certain VM (which is in guest network)

Closes-Bug: #1505175

Change-Id: I664885b5743c0915f5c42aeecdd3c6c538894453
(cherry picked from commit 42d3ce7630821d32f550f9642236545188f13b4a)

Port named pipe handler

in order to interact with VM serial ports.

commit_message:
Refactor deploy_utils methods

deploy_utils.agent_get_clean_steps() is generalized so that by default,
it returns clean steps for all interfaces. To specify a particular
interface, an 'interface' argument is added to the method.

Also override_priorities argument is added, so that we can change
agent-provided priorities to ones from configuration.

Change-Id: I529d99e5072074ecbe175f4558d37e4a6023e76a
Co-Authored-By: Ramakrishnan G <rameshg87@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Implements: blueprint inband-raid-configuration

commit_message:
Show Image ID on Instance Overview

Instances can be filtered by Image ID, but that ID isn't displayed.
This patch shows the Image ID, and also makes the Flavour name more
explicit.

Change-Id: I38c59fb0a387f8f05d42b0a0107d0102a4ddc480
Partial-Bug: 1366320

subject: Pass OpenStackConfig in to CloudConfig for caches
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-14 14:20:47.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/config.py', 'os_client_config/cloud_config.py'], 'message': 'Pass OpenStackConfig in to CloudConfig for caches

The unit of consumption is the CloudConfig object, but the cache
settings are found only globally in the OpenStackConfig object. Pass
the OpenStackConfig object in so that a user consuming settings from
a CloudConfig can find out what the cache settings are.

Change-Id: I633e35b1d7f295581d7abed9c3957e802690614e
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Pass OpenStackConfig in to CloudConfig for caches

The unit of consumption is the CloudConfig object, but the cache
settings are found only globally in the OpenStackConfig object. Pass
the OpenStackConfig object in so that a user consuming settings from
a CloudConfig can find out what the cache settings are.

Change-Id: I633e35b1d7f295581d7abed9c3957e802690614e

commit_message:
Change RHEL subscription template path

In I8f117a49fd128f268659525dd03ad46ba3daa1bc RHEL subsrciption files
are moved from post_deploy into pre_deploy phase. Same path
should be used in CLI too.

Change-Id: I52fcc75fa72c23fbd6ccd0991387c97ccba8cd20
Depends-on: I8f117a49fd128f268659525dd03ad46ba3daa1bc

commit_message:
V-38500: No UID 0 accounts except root

This task will check for accounts with UID that aren't root. No action is
taken on these accounts, but the playbook will fail with an error message.

Change-Id: I2cd2a24c64e4139ce21fbe30107346e30b280e62

commit_message:
Default Sidebar should grow with page height

The 'default' theme sidebar needs to grow with the size of the page,
rather than just spanning the initial viewport on page load.

Change-Id: I7fbdacb517541f9e35d1887b3af80a918a1aa497
Closes-bug: #1485764

subject: Change Install link to Kilo
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-15 09:01:27.000000000', 'files': ['doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_upgrades.xml'], 'message': 'Change Install link to Kilo

The Ops Guide upgrade chapter is based on the
3-node architecture described in pre-Liberty
Installation Guides. The Liberty Install Guide
uses a 2-node arch. Until the upgrade content is
revised to 2-nodes, we should link to the Kilo
3-node version.

Change-Id: I97e8bf300c305ebc28b2e08747b4883e3a28bb4b
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Change Install link to Kilo

The Ops Guide upgrade chapter is based on the
3-node architecture described in pre-Liberty
Installation Guides. The Liberty Install Guide
uses a 2-node arch. Until the upgrade content is
revised to 2-nodes, we should link to the Kilo
3-node version.

Change-Id: I97e8bf300c305ebc28b2e08747b4883e3a28bb4b

commit_message:
Adding functional tests for SSH actions

 * Added 2 tests: for SSHAction and SSHProxiedAction
 * 2 VMs are created for test purposes

 * SSHProxiedAction test checks that ssh command was
   executed on certain VM (which is in guest network)

Closes-Bug: #1505175

commit_message:
Don't require latest package version

For tasks that install packages via apt, don't require the latest version
to be installed. Accept whatever version is currently installed and leave
the updating of packages to deployers.

Closes-bug: 1506128

Change-Id: I81dd4edc82e4b8c89c7b8b8277d2f4bae69ea004

commit_message:
Support for the Opencontrail controller

This commit aims to add the neccesary puppet bits so one can deploy an
opencontrail controller.

The puppet-contrail modules aims to configure all aspects of contrail on
both controller and vrouter.

The puppet-cassandra, puppet-kafka and puppet-zookeeper modules are here
in order to configure properly the respective databases on which
Opencontrail controller relies.

Change-Id: I1b0f5b4ae4a892c687007e79e3ffd60851552879
Depends-On: I7455c71ca8747ee05b5a87362e2bd6a5527f86c8

commit_message:
Add contrail-repo element

This commit adds the contrail-repo element, allowing one to install
contrail packages. Contrail does not provide open repositories one needs
to get them from their Juniper Software Download page and then host them
in a reachable place for diskimage-builder to go pick it up from there.

Only works with CentOS/RHEL at the moment.

Change-Id: I7455c71ca8747ee05b5a87362e2bd6a5527f86c8

commit_message:
Fixed the code syntax in Cloud Administrator Guide

In Manage and unmanage share subsection, Shared File System
section in Cloud Administrator Guide, the code wrapper syntax
is not correct. The correct syntax should be single quote rather
than double quote. This patche fixed this error.

Change-Id: Icb221b53659182dcaeabccc33c360d9bc177731b

commit_message:
Liberty release updates

With the release of liberty, some links in this guide
needed to be updated. Where possible, links were updated
to liberty. Since the guide appears to rely on the older
3-node architecture, some links have only been updated to
the kilo release (which is the same as Juno).

Change-Id: Ifc2ea3ea926dff139b9ea93e4919ee0876bace54

use oslo_config namespace

   contain oslo.config namespace

This patch updates the ops guide to remove some ancient cruft
and update "current" links to the Liberty release URLs. Includes:
* remove note on period tasks fixed in Grizzly
* IPv6 support now works in neutron
* global clustering is no longer a new feature
* glance quotas is no longer a new feature

commit_message:
Liberty release cruft updates

This patch updates the ops guide to remove some ancient cruft
and update "current" links to the Liberty release URLs. Includes:
* remove note on period tasks fixed in Grizzly
* IPv6 support now works in neutron
* global clustering is no longer a new feature
* glance quotas is no longer a new feature
* object quotas is no longer a new feature

Change-Id: Ic572e7872b65fd308227add2a1aafac262c435da

commit_message:
Simplify rpc_backend parameter

It is no longer necessary to specify the whole python namespace
for the backends, and
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.messaging/opts.html lists
the short versions.

This patch maintains backwards compatibility with the previous
default value in case it is explicitly used.

Change-Id: Ic16d12e9e84083c09f3d725e5a15f4c3d7279792

commit_message:
Handle port_other_config=None in port_bound

In some cases db_get_val returns None but port_bound always expects
a dict.

Handled this case and fixed UT  so that they more fully reflect the
changes to port_bound method that were introduced by
I90b4d2485e3e491f496dfb7bdee03d57f393be35.

Change-Id: I9f2c9629c522e9ff79355b2f12ed907cf9449a55
Closes-Bug: #1455320

commit_message:
Simplify rpc_backend parameter

It is no longer necessary to specify the whole python namespace
for the backends, and
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.messaging/opts.html lists
the short versions.

This patch maintains backwards compatibility with the previous
default value in case it is explicitly used.

Change-Id: Iefbc6720547b7380819bc3920ffbfe5b014144e3

generic option ssh_conn_timeout

commit_message:
Adjust jobs after HA Guide RST conversion

The ha-guide repo is now using only RST guides, we thus can remove some
jobs.

Create a new tempate openstack-doc-gate and use it for both RST only
guides - security-doc and ha-guide.

Change-Id: I3647bd4591419b8f30520b08c2d51796ad46b27a
Depends-On: I4afef0100d21aaa7215ac7f1ee49fdd4c3e7a4e3

commit_message:
Port test_srb to Python 3

* Replace itertools.izip() with six.moves.zip()
* Replace (int, long) with six.integer_types
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_srb

Disable pylint on six.moves.zip() because pylint doesn't handle
correctly six.moves, see:
https://bitbucket.org/logilab/pylint/issues/200/

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I5ce550107ce5a72fee87e36bfb56a9794789b43a

commit_message:
Add retry to iSCSI delete

Looks like there might be a race in trying to delete
a target immediately after a logout.  I've seen this
a couple times in my CI system this week, but it
certainly doesn't seem at all prevalent.
This patch just adds a simple retry with delay that should
take care of any race issues here.
Also addressed some pep8 violations while touching the file.

(cherry picked from commit fe925a27c53504e837819415ce5191e9c43f9f87)
Change-Id: I7a57687cac311c5e53361ccbceb1addb419f1e9f
Closes-Bug: 1324670

commit_message:
Provide the executor 'wait' function a timeout and use it

To make sure that waiting can be limited by some value, and
will not block forever add and use a timeout keyword argument
to the wait method so that waiting can be limited to some time
duration.

Change-Id: I2529e7bdc2ad449ab9de935c6bc4c6ea144e4f87

commit_message:
Add missing tests and generator code for IPOpt

The help generator was missing some handling of IPOpt type.  This
patch also beefs up the tests of IPOpt to be on par with other
config option types.

Change-Id: Ie68218d20318f367eb9f4eb90843ea54cba64e41

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-25 16:58:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix /NetworkDriver.CreateEndpoint to handle the empty Interfaces

The current /NetworkDriver.CreateEndpiont doesn't handle the case
libnetwork gives the empty Interfaces property in the request and it's
failed when it receives the request which has the empty Interfaces
property. However, with the libnetwork CLI in Docker 1.8.0, we can't
specify the Interfaces property and it's always empty.

This patch makes Kuryr put a new entry with the ID 0 and the generated
random MAC address, and Address or AddressIPv6 are filled by allocated
ones.

Change-Id: I689d2f3aa8c5d047dbdcfee425910951530fb621
Signed-off-by: Taku Fukushima <f.tac.mac@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1499779

commit_message:
Fix /NetworkDriver.CreateEndpoint to handle the empty Interfaces

The current /NetworkDriver.CreateEndpiont doesn't handle the case
libnetwork gives the empty Interfaces property in the request and it's
failed when it receives the request which has the empty Interfaces
property. However, with the libnetwork CLI in Docker 1.8.0 we can't
specify the Interfaces property and it's always empty.

This patch makes Kuryr put a new entry with the ID 0 if it receives the
empty interface dictionary in the requests. MacAddress and Address or
AddressIPv6 are filled by allocated ones.

Change-Id: I689d2f3aa8c5d047dbdcfee425910951530fb621
Signed-off-by: Taku Fukushima <f.tac.mac@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1499779

commit_message:
Use the subcomand parsed args instead of the base

Pass the subcomand's arguments instead of the base ones to the endpoint
creation call when quering the `/versions` endpoint. Passing the wrong
arguments will end in the auth_requirement not being identified and an
error 'Expected Endpoint' will be raised as no endpoint will be gotten
from keystone.

This patch also removes an unnecessary mock in the test code related to
this fix.

Closes-bug: #1504058
Change-Id: I46088130b9175798e3719e43f48dc474fbc8a251
(cherry picked from commit 36937bbf6300a468f0eb1da5461c2edeb8d47a44)

commit_message:
Start the nova-cert service in HA setup

Currently the nova-cert service is only started in a one node setup but
not when deploying an HA setup. This commit adds the resource that will
start the service.

commit_message:
Fix some errors in 'dashboard_manage_volumes.rst'

The "Snapshot" is not one item of the "Volume Source", and the
"Availability Zone" is a independent item and not under
"Volume Source". This patch fix them.

Change-Id: I40d6735a2e3faf856b208d9ca474dad1304bd901
Closes-bug: #1504475

subject: Return None from generic plugin if failure
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-15 01:20:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Return None from generic plugin if failure

The create_plugin method can be called multiple times with different
version values and the generic plugin should return an object if it is
suitable. By raising an error here when you have invalid parameters it
prevents the generic handler attempting additional version options.

Change-Id: I3391c6607fc53a154e10bee7e741bf73afeae5fa
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-15 02:36:41.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/tests/unit/loading/test_generic.py', 'keystoneauth1/identity/generic/password.py'], 'message': 'Return None from generic plugin if failure

The create_plugin method can be called multiple times with different
version values and the generic plugin should return an object if it is
suitable. By raising an error here when you have invalid parameters it
prevents the generic handler attempting additional version options.

Change-Id: I3391c6607fc53a154e10bee7e741bf73afeae5fa
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Return None from generic plugin if failure

The create_plugin method can be called multiple times with different
version values and the generic plugin should return an object if it is
suitable. By raising an error here when you have invalid parameters it
prevents the generic handler attempting additional version options.

Change-Id: I3391c6607fc53a154e10bee7e741bf73afeae5fa

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1865, 'name': 'Andrea Rosa', 'email': 'andrea.rosa@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-rosa-m'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16897, 'name': 'Virtuozzo Storage CI', 'email': 'vzstorage-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'vzstorage-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-14 14:27:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix service_version minimum calculation for compute RPC

The compute rpcapi module incorrectly specified the binary as "compute"
instead of "nova-compute" when calling get_minimum_version() on the
Service object class. This resulted in always getting back a zero answer.

This patch fixes that, adds a warning if the method is called with a

commit_message:
Fix service_version minimum calculation for compute RPC

The compute rpcapi module incorrectly specified the binary as "compute"
instead of "nova-compute" when calling get_minimum_version() on the
Service object class. This resulted in always getting back a zero answer.

This patch fixes that, adds a warning and an exception if the method
is called with a binary that doesn't start with "nova-" and corrects
the tests.

Change-Id: I265ee1e14335f837eac4c07dc19dcb7ac5d63886
Closes-Bug: #1506089

commit_message:
tests: We must call rpc stop before rpc wait

oslo.messaging recommands to call stop before wait.

Before oslo.messaging 2.6.0, a warning was printed
when this is not the case.

A bug in oslo.messaging 2.6.0, lockup the rpc transport
instead of just printing the warning.

This change fixes that.

Change-Id: I900fd7c63cc5414242c38ed69ef1899fac924b46

commit_message:
Return project id for floating ip

Now there are some attributes of floating ip existing in DB
but didn't publish, such as project_id, host, auto_assigned,
etc. However, the project id is very important for billing.
So this patch publishs the project and updates some test
cases accordingly.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1174802

Change-Id: I499c117cff920deaf337ade3ad4548429835fea5

commit_message:
Server list filter with tenant_id implies all_tenants

When server list with tenant_id filter is requested,
then all_tenant is not considered as enabled unless it is explicitly
enabled in filter options.

But tenant_id filter should imply all_tenants is also enabled unless
explicitly disabled.

This only occurs if request is from admin.

This commit fix this issue for both v2 and v2.1.

Closes-Bug: 1468992

Depends-On: I556fa1669e9e7bc0d665a4fdf926394671321bca

Change-Id: I0c576e39f16dd85b62e3adad735acc8f391ca0ca

commit_message:
Fix multipath performance issue in LibvirtISCSIDriver

Optimized the way to find all paths of a multipath device.
Parses the output of "multipath -ll" to get the devnodes
of all paths. Any device under /dev/disk/by-path
linked to /dev/<devnode> will be a path of the multipath
device.

Change-Id: I8afb7a405262b1ae281896f031359b2ac9903d36
Closes-Bug: 1454978

commit_message:
Allow config drives to be generated to a directory

It makes more sense for container systems to generate the config
drive to a directory which can then be added to the container
instead of generating a block device to loop mount.

Change-Id: I3bd5e50b36249072c2e0156082a49d25605a2143

commit_message:
Build config drives as directories for PCS

This is intended as an example, do not merge it as it. It
demonstrates how the PCS folk can now build a config drive as a
directory, but it doesn't implement any of the container work
to wire that up.

Change-Id: I5b8c3e6170c684bab56bd8bdead88bff99539caa

commit_message:
Compute: be consistent with logs about NotImplemented methods

This patch ensures consistency with the logging when methods
throw a NotImplemented exception. This will have a debug log message
and not a warning.

NOTE: there are 3 methods that do not have the debug logs:
1. set_admin_password (warning) - as the API call does not work
2. get_all_bw_counters (info) - this is done once
3. resume_state_on_host_boot (warning) - a configuration variable
   indicates that this method should be invoked

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I34a761f8761ab8e1353d07fa6c5b596aa88ab683

commit_message:
Perform port_rescan on s390x platforms


When adding Fibre-Channel block storage on Linux on System z and
auto-port scanning has been turned off, Fibre-channel target ports need
to be added explicitely by OpenStack. If this is not done, OpenStack
will fail to add volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1475655

Change-Id: I76cb8db9905872fde5dc05a2db5e76e4ba229c69

commit_message:
Thoughts on atomic host/node transfer during evacuate

Fix the following races in evacuate:

- Original host comes back up during evacuate
- 2 simultaneous evacuations of the same host

What if API and Compute are upgraded at different times?

What are the implications of host/node == none. Could it get lost?

Change-Id: Icda8397055f894b0e54c07bc756f7d60448e1b89

commit_message:
hardware: take into account pages size when computing memory

Since we support different kinds of page size. The global information
of memory cannot be used to compute whether an instance can fit an
host cell. We need to check if we have enough pages to handle the
request.

Change-Id: Ia0fa7704f8ab00e7891fde5a9a19a602256f194e
Closes-Bug: #1428551

commit_message:
[WIP] Use explicit greenthread.sleep instead of time.sleep

Nova uses *green thread* model of threading, implemented through
using eventlet. Current nova uses explicit greenthread.sleep(0)
and implicit time.sleep(0) to yield the thread in long-running
task. According to doc/source/threading.rst, we only recommend
the explicit one.

Note: this commit doesn't change tests.

Change-Id: I19704947cf84fed7d21dd13b4836e7dba2b9b024

The periodic task heal_instance_info_cache is enhanced by a
spacing parameter. It means 0 to use the default interval and -1
to desactivate it. This commit updates the code to use the default
behavior used in Nova and keep the option coherent with others.

Also update the help of the option to refer what mean 0 and -1

commit_message:
compute: remove unnecessary condition in task info_cache

The periodic task heal_instance_info_cache is enhanced by a
spacing parameter. It means 0 to use the default interval and -1
to desactivate it. This commit updates the code to use the default
behavior used in Nova and keep the option coherent with others.

Also update the help of the option to refer what mean 0 and -1

DocImpact: The help option has been updated
UpgradeImpact: 0 now means default interval and -1 is used to
               desactivate the task
Change-Id: I213baf845d191e9640e6ca165fe7c6684ef09a01

commit_message:
Upgrade Elasticsearch and Kibana

Elasticsearch and Kibana have both received upgrades that introduce
security fixes, and this version bump addresses there.

There are yet-newer versions of Elasticsearch, Logstash, and Kibana
(ELK), but each one introduces new architectural changes to their
repsective programs, and thus would require more testing. As Juno is
nearly EOL, this patch only bumps to the most recent versions that do
not introduce the upstream version changes.

Change-Id: I44d4b10e55717f5ae29227e0dba204750505700f
Closes-Bug: #1472702

commit_message:
Correct disk usages for boot-from-volume instances

If instance is booted from volume then set 'root_gb' of
instance to zero. Because of this it will not update 'local_gb_used'
resource.

In case of resize action need to set 'root_gb' of
new_instance_type to 0. Also need to set 'root_gb' of flavor to
0 in resize claim if instance is booted from volume.

Changed DiskFilter to check if instance has 'image_ref' or not.
If instance do not contain 'image_ref' then instance_type 'root_gb'
will not be added to 'requested_disk' size.

Change-Id: I08a69fa35cdb05d68e419599e6e52dc2f17f504d
Closes-Bug: #1334974

commit_message:
implements block volume quota per instance

A countable quota resource, volumes_per_instance with default
value 20, is added. Same is checked when a volume attach event
is called. Relevant changes needs to be made in novaclient
too to display the quota and add argument for update quota.

In child cell the unknown quota resource is ignored.

patch 2: fixed failing unit test because of previous error

Implements: blueprint block-volume-limit-per-instance
Change-Id: I27ce797208b53877806fbaf5088bff60212fe857

commit_message:
Pass requested_networks to scheduler

The network requests can be useful for scheduler to make network
related placement decisions. This patch adds this piece of information
to request_spec, thus the scheduler can make use of it.

Change-Id: I696a7ac1fe95e410d05e5fae1cccdbec39cba7ca

commit_message:
Convert set() to list in ListType

ListType should return a list instead of set, As set is not json
serializable

Change-Id: I06011929022c124883a00cdf5784ed63f79f48a5

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-09 20:35:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/xenapi/vm_utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_vm_utils.py'], 'message': 'xenapi: read max cpu socket count from instance metadata

Certain Windows applications like MSSQL only support a limited number of
cpu sockets, but users want to utlize all CPUs in these applications. Thus,
this patch fixes the issue by splitting up the number of cpu cores per cpu
socket. This is done by reading hw_cpu_max_sockets from the instance metadata
and setting "cores-per-socket" appropriately in the image rec passed to xen.
Only Windows instances are affected by this fix. If an instance lacks this
property, it will behave as it did previously with a default "cores-per-socket"
value of 1.

Change-Id: I0672a9e2ce65c408bd8c50563fd9300094c30137
Co-Authored-By: John Garbutt <john@johngarbutt.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
xenapi: read max cpu socket count from instance metadata

Certain Windows applications like MSSQL only support a limited number of
cpu sockets, but users want to utlize all CPUs in these applications. Thus,
this patch fixes the issue by splitting up the number of cpu cores per cpu
socket. This is done by reading hw_cpu_max_sockets from the instance metadata
and setting "cores-per-socket" appropriately in the image rec passed to xen.
Only Windows instances are affected by this fix. If an instance lacks this
property, it will behave as it did previously with a default "cores-per-socket"
value of 1.

Change-Id: I0672a9e2ce65c408bd8c50563fd9300094c30137
Co-Authored-By: John Garbutt <john@johngarbutt.com>

commit_message:
Allow TimeOverride to take a specific time

This allows us to specify a specific time for comparison in tests,
which is required in the patch series to enable running test_db_api
against MySQL.

Change-Id: Ief8dba17b7f89c83d098673ca7aa112e05f8a406

commit_message:
Libvirt virt driver: custom inject partition

When using qemu-nbd/losetup for data injection, on the contrary
to liguestfs, there is no possible smart discovery
of the system partition.
Thus we offer the possibility for the user
to specify the system partition number through
a glance image property called inject_partition

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint custom-inject-partition
Change-Id: I12cdaea31efd55c4ae0826a7ee54b73d746e8d3e

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-18 12:42:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Remove bdm record from db

If rabbitmq server or nova compute service crashes just before sending
response to the nova-api for the 'reserve_block_device_name' rpcapi call,
then the bdm record remains in the db forever. Now, in this stage, if you
attempt to attach the same volume to the same or different instance,
then it create another bdm entry. During detaching volume from instance,
it raises TypeError.

Added code to remove bdm record from db if reserve_block_device_name fails
for any reason.

Closes-Bug: #1377161
Change-Id: I68bc4913b45042c58fbcf7cbb88b4a23529f58a3
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove bdm record from db

If rabbitmq server or nova compute service crashes just before sending
response to the nova-api for the 'reserve_block_device_name' rpcapi call,
then the bdm record remains in the db forever. Now, in this stage, if you
attempt to attach the same volume to the same or different instance,
then it create another bdm entry. During detaching volume from instance,
it raises TypeError.

Added code to remove bdm record from db if reserve_block_device_name fails
for any reason.

Closes-Bug: #1377161
Change-Id: I68bc4913b45042c58fbcf7cbb88b4a23529f58a3

subject: Added backporting of embedded Network object when backporting a FixedIP
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 12:22:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/objects/test_fixed_ip.py', 'nova/objects/fixed_ip.py'], 'message': "Added backporting of embedded Network object when backporting a FixedIP

When backporting a FixedIP object to the version 1.1 and less
we must backport Network object to version 1.1, because since
version 1.2, FixedIp object uses Network object v1.2.

This backporting is needed when we use Juno control and
Icehouse compute. In this case Juno nova-conductor sends back
a FixedIP object of version 1.1 with an embedded Network
object of 1.2, icehouse then incorrectly tries to backport
the FixedIP object again (as opposed to the Network object)
leading to a loop.

More information in the bug description.

It's not a cherry-pick from master because this is the
old (manual) way of calculating backports and master uses
a new (automated) mechanism.

Master patch: I5f9fad8228e23457a878e533a0e3d1faf54ee460

Closes-Bug: #1408498

Change-Id: I5f9fad8228e23457a878e533a0e3d1faf54ee460
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Added backporting of embedded Network object when backporting a FixedIP

When backporting a FixedIP object to the version 1.1 and less
we must backport Network object to version 1.1, because since
version 1.2, FixedIp object uses Network object v1.2.

This backporting is needed when we use Juno control and
Icehouse compute. In this case Juno nova-conductor sends back
a FixedIP object of version 1.1 with an embedded Network
object of 1.2, icehouse then incorrectly tries to backport
the FixedIP object again (as opposed to the Network object)
leading to a loop.

More information in the bug description.

It's not a cherry-pick from master because this is the
old (manual) way of calculating backports and master uses
a new (automated) mechanism.

Master patch: I5f9fad8228e23457a878e533a0e3d1faf54ee460

Closes-Bug: #1408498

Change-Id: I5f9fad8228e23457a878e533a0e3d1faf54ee460

commit_message:
WIP: Add devref for event notifications

Originally written by Brad Pokorny in Grizzly when he was with IBM, this
is a starting point to get the SystemUsageData wiki moved into devref so
the event notifications in nova are closer to the source and hence the
releases they were added.

Co-authored-by: Brad Pokorny <bpokorny@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: If094496a2db37f125dc33063c6428aad164e66b8

commit_message:
Add a new parameter connector into migrate_volume_completion

Since the volume and the iscsi target need to remain the same as
the source volume after the migration, the connector is used to
reconnect to the volume after migration.

Change-Id: I692829046a263445c8fe0af0bc4f597a09315b21
Partially-closes-bug: #1450649

Remove references of CLI from docs

If we are removing the CLI from keystoneclient, then we should
remove references from the docs as well.

[{'created': '2015-10-14 05:50:03.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/loading/opts.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/loading/test_conf.py'], 'message': 'Fix deprecated options in oslo_config

commit_message:
Fix deprecated options in oslo_config

Converting a keystoneauth Opt to an oslo_config Opt fails because we
convert the deprecated options to a real oslo_config Opt rather than a
DeprecatedOpt.

Change-Id: I1c86bec7cddcc5751e6584b381e60115b84e1d27
Closes-Bug: #1505906

commit_message:
Change default Exception code to 500

As a part of the fix for LP#1505153, the invalid
response of 0 was changed to 400 to fix a running
issue with the new version of WebOb.

It was pointed out after the fact  however that a
500 might be more appropriate here.

Additionally, other projects have implemented a 500
as the default so for the sake of consistency we should
consider doing the same.

This patch just changes the 400 to a 500 as the default
code.

Change-Id: Ie486dc49c927f9b50f07c1fc562e89c090924a40
Closes-Bug: #1505488

commit_message:
Remove instance group member when delete instance

Currently after instance deleted, the instance is still as member
of instance group. This patch make sure the instance will removed
from instance group when execute instance_destroy db call.

Change-Id: I3d9e0713e8d00afabcb183331bd67a543cd9a4c4
Closes-Bug: #1442098

commit_message:
Use the node built-in 'dfs_iter' instead of recursion

We can just use the non-recursive depth first iteration
of nodes when scanning for atoms to select for a given
scope level instead of using recursive calls to achieve
the same effect.

This makes it possible to have large and heavily nested
flows that are not restricted by the python stack limit.

Change-Id: I0d18565680f777adbdfca9d4983636c6b3e848da

commit_message:
Split out instance provisioning to on_demand and pez (WIP)

This splits up the ways in which the Rug may request an instance
to be used for an appliance.  We preserve existing behavior of
booting a new instance on-demand as the on_demand instance provider
and introduce a new pez instance provider that requests already-booted
appliance VMs from the Pez service.

Partially-implements: blueprint nodepool-support

Change-Id: I00b3f5e3f8e6b65b860acce7ab1772635d9cdf6d

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-10 00:03:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add akanda-pez-service RPC server and client (WIP)

Adds plumbing for a Pez RPC server and corresponding client-side
RPC API.

Change-Id: I71d77a5d76413efd0a363c1a82a1555b36b8bf50
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-15 21:41:08.000000000', 'files': ['akanda/rug/pez/service.py', 'akanda/rug/api/nova.py', 'akanda/rug/pez/manager.py', 'akanda/rug/pez/pool.py', 'akanda/rug/test/unit/pez/test_pool_manager.py', 'akanda/rug/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'akanda/rug/pez/rpcapi.py', 'setup.cfg', 'akanda/rug/pez/__init__.py', 'akanda/rug/api/neutron.py', 'akanda/rug/common/rpc.py'], 'message': 'Add akanda-pez-service RPC server and client (WIP)

This adds a new RPC service (akanda-pez-service) and its associated
client side API.  This service manages a pool of unused appliance

commit_message:
Add akanda-pez-service RPC server and client (WIP)

This adds a new RPC service (akanda-pez-service) and its associated
client side API.  This service manages a pool of unused appliance
instances that serve as standby nodes for when RUG provisions a new
appliance.

Change-Id: I71d77a5d76413efd0a363c1a82a1555b36b8bf50

commit_message:
Add initial pez pool manager

Adds the pool manager for pez, which is responsible for
keeping the pool of nodes replenished.

Need to determine how we handle instances that are stuck in an
error or deleting state. See comments in-line.

Change-Id: I8511b8bfec83698991ad9b14f93e5a5bfe753cff

[{'created': '2015-09-22 01:28:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Handle edge case converting a non uuid user_id

If a user_id just happens to be of 16 character length, this will
cause the convert_uuid_bytes_to_hex function to improperly return
a UUID value instead of the user_id string unconverted.

To fix this case, we need to identify when the user_id was actually
converted or not. The payload needs a new boolean that indicates
whether there was a conversion or not for user_id and other various
potential UUID strings.

Closes-Bug: #1497461

commit_message:
Handle 16-char non-uuid user IDs in payload

If a user_id just happens to be of 16 character length, this will
cause the convert_uuid_bytes_to_hex function to improperly return
a UUID value instead of the user_id string unconverted.

This patch modifies the payload to indicate whether the ID was in
fact a UUID and the attempt to convert to bytes was successful.

This change has effect on more than just user IDs.  It also resovles
potential issues with project IDs, group IDs, IDP IDs, and scope IDs.

Change-Id: Ia4a4f760d67d8bbc22759c48fc800aef016b84ed
Closes-Bug: #1497461

commit_message:
Pass the status 'ACTIVE' for getting a target port

The gate test failed because Tempest could not distinguish a target
port for floating-ip due to existence of multiple ports. The one port
was the status 'ACTIVE', but the other was 'DOWN'.
At least a target port should be ACTIVE, so this patch makes Tempest
pass the status 'ACTIVE' for getting a target port.

Change-Id: If5b9054284547099d8a64a2e3a608e9810b22067
Related-Bug: #1505947

commit_message:
Simplify RDO install

We can just directly install the latest RDO repo rather than having to
keep this up-to-date.  I don't think there is actually much there we
need any more; there was a lot more coming from RDO in the centos6
days.  openvswitch is one big one, however.

Change-Id: I42b8bc1aea8ff61770987eecd5fc3b8309c1e210

commit_message:
Extend the ServiceTooOld exception with more data

This extends the ServiceTooOld exception with details of the current
and calculated minimum versions to make it easier to diagnose
failures.

Related to blueprint service-version-behavior

Change-Id: Icf087e9a1264428c363f5ed618804f0bbee16c91

commit_message:
Remove extra install of release pkgs in fedora-minimal

I'm not sure why we try to do an extra install of these, it is done
inside the chroot in _install_repos.  Currently it just gets skipped
saying the packages are already installed.

Change-Id: Ic7aa8cbe13e4347b447e84bb9c12483a4e125228

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-13 16:31:35.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'cinder/exception.py'], 'message': "Squashed commit of WebOb 1.5 and oslo.db fixes

Add testresources and testscenarios used by oslo.db fixture

If we use oslo.db fixtures, we'll need these 2 packages or
the next version of oslo.db release will break us.

Closes-Bug: #1503501
Change-Id: I8facdaf69c79b1b1ae4f9f64e9856e12f14440ed
(cherry picked from commit ec40c3b6ddbfa4912ca6e612558efaef6043f3ae)

Fix test_misc for WebOb 1.5

WebOb 1.5 was released at 2015-10-11. With this new version,
webob.exc.WSGIHTTPException() constructor now fails with a KeyError
when the HTTP status code is 0.

test_exceptions_raise() of test_misc tries to instanciate all
exceptions of cinder.exception. The problem is that
ConvertedException uses a default HTTP status code of 0.

Modify the default HTTP status code of ConvertedException to 400 to
fix the unit test. The bug is only in the test,
cinder/api/openstack/wsgi.py copies an existing HTTP code:

    Fault(exception.ConvertedException(code=ex_value.code,  ...)

Closes-Bug: #1505153
Change-Id: I1aec8038774828d48da4b0e831b390e33243809a
(cherry picked from commit 867fccf833ffc597aa986cb6ff1b3b5c1101b9ba)

Change default Exception code to 500

As a part of the fix for LP#1505153, the invalid
response of 0 was changed to 400 to fix a running
issue with the new version of WebOb.

It was pointed out after the fact  however that a
500 might be more appropriate here.

Additionally, other projects have implemented a 500
as the default so for the sake of consistency we should
consider doing the same.

This patch just changes the 400 to a 500 as the default
code.

Conflicts:
        cinder/tests/unit/test_exception.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to 17802086f not being
in stable/liberty.

Change-Id: Ie486dc49c927f9b50f07c1fc562e89c090924a40
Closes-Bug: #1505488
(cherry picked from commit 9a7cbe540c94d54194194f4747a52b8211f6372e)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Squashed commit of WebOb 1.5 and oslo.db fixes

Add testresources and testscenarios used by oslo.db fixture

If we use oslo.db fixtures, we'll need these 2 packages or
the next version of oslo.db release will break us.

Closes-Bug: #1503501
Change-Id: I8facdaf69c79b1b1ae4f9f64e9856e12f14440ed
(cherry picked from commit ec40c3b6ddbfa4912ca6e612558efaef6043f3ae)

Fix test_misc for WebOb 1.5

WebOb 1.5 was released at 2015-10-11. With this new version,
webob.exc.WSGIHTTPException() constructor now fails with a KeyError
when the HTTP status code is 0.

test_exceptions_raise() of test_misc tries to instanciate all
exceptions of cinder.exception. The problem is that
ConvertedException uses a default HTTP status code of 0.

Modify the default HTTP status code of ConvertedException to 400 to
fix the unit test. The bug is only in the test,
cinder/api/openstack/wsgi.py copies an existing HTTP code:

    Fault(exception.ConvertedException(code=ex_value.code,  ...)

Closes-Bug: #1505153
Change-Id: I1aec8038774828d48da4b0e831b390e33243809a
(cherry picked from commit 867fccf833ffc597aa986cb6ff1b3b5c1101b9ba)

Change default Exception code to 500

As a part of the fix for LP#1505153, the invalid
response of 0 was changed to 400 to fix a running
issue with the new version of WebOb.

It was pointed out after the fact  however that a
500 might be more appropriate here.

Additionally, other projects have implemented a 500
as the default so for the sake of consistency we should
consider doing the same.

This patch just changes the 400 to a 500 as the default
code.

Conflicts:
        cinder/tests/unit/test_exception.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to 17802086f not being
in stable/liberty.

Change-Id: Ie486dc49c927f9b50f07c1fc562e89c090924a40
Closes-Bug: #1505488
(cherry picked from commit 9a7cbe540c94d54194194f4747a52b8211f6372e)

commit_message:
Implement horizon venv support

This commit conditionally allows the os_horizon role to
install build and deploy within a venv. This is the new
default behavior of the role however the functionality
can be disabled.

Change-Id: I136eed8bd40f4ae5bc77f3fa925e4cbc6f842271
Implements: blueprint enable-venv-support-within-the-roles
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Added table name and fixed description in User Guide

This patch added the table name in OpenStack command-line
clients section of User Guide. This patch also revised sentences
in the description column of this table to follow singular forms.

Closes-Bug: #1505543
Change-Id: Ibe62befee20488410794dcb0f87fcd250a292072

commit_message:
Tox fast8: use pep8 env dir

This reuses the .tox/pep8 environment rather than
building a separate .tox/fast8 environment for
fast8.

This reduces duplicated install time and disk space.

Change-Id: I230465b28ba3d0f2c3a2ba38011ff9f7d472d719

subject: Only wait for SSH if the container config has changed
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-14 16:53:46.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/rsyslog-install.yml', 'playbooks/galera-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-neutron-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-heat-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-nova-install.yml', 'playbooks/rabbitmq-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-glance-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-ceilometer-install.yml', 'playbooks/memcached-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-swift-setup.yml', 'playbooks/os-horizon-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-keystone-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-cinder-install.yml', 'playbooks/utility-install.yml', 'playbooks/repo-server.yml'], 'message': 'Only wait for SSH if the container config has changed

This patch reduces the time it takes for the playbooks to execute when the
container configuration has not changed as the task to wait for a successful
ssh connection (after an initial delay) is not executed.

Change-Id: I52727d6422878c288884a70c466ccc98cd6fd0ff
(cherry picked from commit e343d6e9fe15f9f3ae4ee1502fbf2a280af19209)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Only wait for SSH if the container config has changed

This patch reduces the time it takes for the playbooks to execute when the
container configuration has not changed as the task to wait for a successful
ssh connection (after an initial delay) is not executed.

Change-Id: I52727d6422878c288884a70c466ccc98cd6fd0ff

commit_message:
Fix registration failure caused by TLS support

Currently, Magnum supports TLS to communicate with kubernetes.
In order to register minions, we must use client cert and key.
This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I0e4631beca3436799acbd3e0c8c00616b7fbec7d
Closes-Bug: #1506241

commit_message:
Judge OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE is not empty before exec ip cmd

Currently in the function cleanup_neutron, it will exec
'ip -f inet6 a s dev "$OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE"' directly. If the value
OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE is empty, it will cause the report of usage
(ip addr).

Judge the value before exec the command.

Change-Id: Ib3b575172b2b6618b7fdf0b88c9d7056ac5e5948
Closes-Bug: #1504590

commit_message:
Fix the referred [app:app_v3] into [pipeline:api_v3]

The pipe is defined in [pipeline] sections, not in [app] sections.

A couple of lines below, the name (app_v3) is used in the composite
application, where it is referred to as api_v3. This patch makes this
consistent.

Change-Id: Iec18b017777bf1e7d182fbbe78f73d5241c81135
Signed-off-by: Gerhard Muntingh <gerhard@qux.nl>

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-11 14:39:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Improve PLUMgrid Install Endpoints

PLUMgrid Plugin has moved out of Neutron tree and it's new
home is openstack/networking-plumgrid[1]. With core vendor
decomposition reaching completion, this change moves
PLUMgrid Plugin install to an external DevStack plugin
for better integration.

Also, with phase II of decomposition [2] in Liberty,
all the plugin files will be moved out of Neutron tree.
DevStack lib/neutron-legacy makes some assumption regarding
the location of plugin conf files being available in neutron
code paths, so added a new parameter to override the assumption,
which can be set from an external DevStack plugin.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/networking-plumgrid
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron/devref/contribute.html

Change-Id: I5bd6d8f611c2a134f2e8f14c074c1a4185d9c522

commit_message:
Improve PLUMgrid Install Endpoints

PLUMgrid Plugin has moved out of Neutron tree and it's new
home is openstack/networking-plumgrid[1]. With core vendor
decomposition reaching completion, this change moves
PLUMgrid Plugin install to an external DevStack plugin
for better integration.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/networking-plumgrid
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron/devref/contribute.html

Change-Id: I5bd6d8f611c2a134f2e8f14c074c1a4185d9c522

commit_message:
Add verification of OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE

OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE is not always set, like when you don't need specify the
bridge mapping, and also it has no default value. So we need to add
verification of OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE in cleanup_neutron function where we refer
to it.

Change-Id: I69d113a7f3f7e67b09cb72fa0b0d3bba188e783a
Close-Bug: #1474634

commit_message:
Update Baymodel in Magnum resources

This updates OS::Magnum::BayModel in the Magnum resources
with the new properties network_driver, http_proxy,
https_proxy, no_proxy, labels, and insecure.

Implements: partial blueprint magnum-resources

commit_message:
Python 3: make post_test_hook work with more tox targets

This makes it possible to run the script with different "flavors" of
"dsvm-functional" and "dsvm-fullstack". In particular, this is needed to
have a dsvm-functional-py34 gate running (see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/233177/).

Change-Id: I38cadeecff6a8c0c55c103095c045a3e0c39bee1
Partial-Bug: #1500400

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-14 04:25:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixes management IP info missing for VDUs

This commit adds code to fix the bug where the management IP info
for multiple VDUs in a VNF are not captured in the outputs section
of the stack heat template. The output section captures just the

Closes-Bug: #1505892
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-14 20:15:38.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/vm/drivers/heat/heat.py'], 'message': 'Fixes management IP info missing for VDUs

for multiple VDUs in a VNF are not captured in the outputs section
of the stack heat template. The output section captures just the

commit_message:
Fixes management IP info missing for VDUs

This commit adds code to fix the bug where the management IP info
for multiple VDUs in a VNF are not captured in the outputs section
of the stack heat template. The output section captures just the
info for the last created VDU.

Change-Id: I25aea659ef77af89a2f239647539f066bd55d9dd
Closes-Bug: #1505442
Closes-Bug: #1505892

commit_message:
Rename from install_keystone to install_monasca_keystone_client

The function name install_keystone was overriding the function of
the same name in the actual Keystone plugin. Renamed to
install_monasca_keystone_client.

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-13 09:02:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Always send status update for processed floating ips

Currently l3 agent skips status update for floating ips in case
status didn't change: this might be wrong if status has changed
on server side while agent was processing. See bug for details.

L3 agent skips floating ip processing in case ip address exists
on external device. So we can still skip status update for such
floating ips.

Closes-Bug: #1505557
Change-Id: I908fe5a0555f68ab85e7d199c36a903b915e103f

Currently l3 agent skips status update for floating ips in case
status didn't change: this might be wrong if status has changed

commit_message:
Always send status update for processed floating ips

Currently l3 agent skips status update for floating ips in case
status didn't change: this might be wrong if status has changed
on server side while agent was processing. See bug for details.

L3 agent skips floating ip processing in case ip address exists
on external device. So we can still skip status update for such
floating ips.

Closes-Bug: #1505557
Change-Id: I908fe5a0555f68ab85e7d199c36a903b915e103f

commit_message:
Create ipset set_name_exists() method

All the callers of set_exists() already know the set name,
so there's no reason to re-calculate it based on the id and
ethertype. Renamed to set_name_exists() to be clear on what
it is checking.

Change-Id: Ifd2a2c7877c81a440067f9e8a654b49e63199f8c

subject: Do not copy sources
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-14 06:57:30.000000000', 'files': ['security-guide/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Do not copy sources

We do not need to copy source files anymore with current
openstackdocstheme, unset html_show_sourcelink and html_copy_source
links. Report a bug works without these as well.

This reduces the amount of files we build and publish (for Install Guide
from 42 MB to 39 MB), and thus speeds up building (from 44 to 41s for
Install Guide) slightly.

Change-Id: I7990c62db1c58c4cc30dc29c2b4ed1822048d531
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Do not copy sources

We do not need to copy source files anymore with current
openstackdocstheme, unset html_show_sourcelink and html_copy_source
links. Report a bug works without these as well.

This reduces the amount of files we build and publish (for Install Guide
from 42 MB to 39 MB), and thus speeds up building (from 44 to 41s for
Install Guide) slightly.

Change-Id: I7990c62db1c58c4cc30dc29c2b4ed1822048d531

commit_message:
[Contributor Guide] Workflow diagram

- Changes Github.com to git.openstack.org in the
diagram: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/HowTo#Edit_OpenStack_RST_and.2For_DocBook_documentation
also redraws the diagram.
- Adds the diagram to the Quickstart section.

Change-Id: Ib552c29f947f9bc178d93369f95bdae4845276ad
Implements: blueprint docs-contributor-guide

commit_message:
L3 agent: use run_immediately parameter to sync after start

Explicit call to periodic resync after start may lead to
double syncing. See bug for details.

Closes-Bug: #1505282
Change-Id: Ib5e481d579039b2c3e87d4f12cad1241d02fe060

commit_message:
Fix replicator intersection exception when sync data to remote regions.

This patch fixed the exception (AttributeError: 'list' object has no
attribute 'intersection') when replicator try to sync data from
handoff to primary partition in more than one remote region.

This patch is slightly different than the original since Kilo doesn't
use six and still must support py26.

Also updated .coveragerc to handle the config option change

Change-Id: I565c45dda8c99d36e24dbf1145f2d2527d593ac0
Closes-Bug: 1503152

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-28 22:24:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add backup_keystone_url to swift backup driver

Currently the config parameter backup_swift_url expects a
keystone endpoint url in the swift backup driver if you're
using single_user mode, but if you're in per_user mode it
expects a swift endpoint url. This patch adds a parameter
called backup_keystone_url to differentiate the two.

Unit tests are also provided for testing backup_keystone_url.

Change-Id: Iee466fe1404eef9402a19d529dba19c7d5a4ef2b
Closes-Bug: #1449972

commit_message:
Add backup_swift_auth_url to swift backup driver

Currently the config parameter backup_swift_url expects a
keystone endpoint url in the swift backup driver if you're
using single_user mode, but if you're in per_user mode it
expects a swift endpoint url. This patch adds a parameter
called backup_swift_auth_url to differentiate the two.

Unit tests are also provided for testing
backup_swift_auth_url.

DocImpact: The config options "backup_swift_auth_url" and
"keystone_catalog_info" will need to be added to the Cinder
docs.
Change-Id: Iee466fe1404eef9402a19d529dba19c7d5a4ef2b
Closes-Bug: #1449972

commit_message:
Remove extra register_opts() calls in netapp eseries

The eseries/library.py file is importing netapp's
options file. The options file already registers
all of the configuration options. For some reason
the library.py file was re-registering the options
and also properly appending them to the configuration list.

This patch removes the extra register_opts() calls.

Change-Id: Id48fe85acb42c10dc9d13a7fca3f49eec9ea8ce3
closes-bug: 1503405

commit_message:
bump upper constraints of keystonemiddleware and keystoneclient

We were impacted by the release of requests 2.8.0. We released
new versions of these libraries, ksm at 2.4.0 and ksc at 1.8.0,
that do not include that requests version. Our Keystone tests
pull in keystoneclient and keystonemiddleware, so we need to
rely on these new versions to unblock our gate.

Change-Id: Ie1ae6cb589cfcc60392029aa9d3d350212e2f154

commit_message:
cleanup specs for mitaka release

* move specs that were not implemented into backlog, except for
  functional testing and py3, since those are ongoing.
* tweak the landing page to show mitaka instead of liberty.
* add implemeted specs from liberty to implemeted spec page.

Change-Id: I1cd8a8c5415fb1e3a4324ac4a4084ff1b16add70

commit_message:
Include alembic versions directory to the package

If package is built without access to git metadata, all the migration
scripts are not included in the build. We need to explicitly specify to
package the scripts.

This patch also removes non-existing files from MANIFEST.in

Change-Id: I9a2acad13271863ee94de63c2404e8697ea70601
Related-bug: #1505628

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-18 14:52:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix NetApp clone from glance failure

When glance and cinder are backed by the same NetApp DOT flexvol
container, exposed as an NFS share, a direct clone is attempted
of the backing files rather than a copy.  With the advent of
kilo 2015.1.1, this clone operation fails with the message:
"Image cloning unsuccessful ... need more than 2 values to unpack."

The issue here is that the clone path code is calling the parent
nfs class _is_share_eligible() method to see if there is enough
space on the destination flexvol and this method calls _get_capacity_info()
expecting a three-tuple to be returned.  However, commit
e52f304313efc695f7dd89c222041bffd53c131a deliberately changed the return
values of _get_capacity_info() within the NetApp drivers to return
a 2-tuple, based on API calls to obtain capacity information from
the NetApp storage arrays. That commit missed that this method
would also be invoked by the parent nfs class _is_share_eligible()
method, which expects a different signature.

The fix in this commit is to replace the call to the parent
_is_share_eligible() method with a more appropriate NetApp class
specific _share_has_space_for_clone() method.  This new method
uses the NetApp version of _get_capacity_info to get space information
from the arrays via NetApp apis and expects a 2-tuple to be returned
from this method.

Note that although this is a cherry-pick, changes were made
because NetApp Kilo drivers do not support scheduler-based
over-subscription, only the legacy driver-based NFS over-subscription
options.

Change-Id: Ib0c69e5ea7b32d17930fe0bdcdb9357fd4e4a244
Closes-bug: 1490845
(cherry picked from commit cc651ff8c658c4f8d4415d46a348136b653ab30a)

commit_message:
Fix NetApp clone from glance failure

When glance and cinder are backed by the same NetApp DOT flexvol
container, exposed as an NFS share, a direct clone is attempted
of the backing files rather than a copy.  With the advent of
kilo 2015.1.1, this clone operation fails with the message:
"Image cloning unsuccessful ... need more than 2 values to unpack."

The issue here is that the clone path code is calling the parent
nfs class _is_share_eligible() method to see if there is enough
space on the destination flexvol and this method calls _get_capacity_info()
expecting a three-tuple to be returned.  However, commit
e52f304313efc695f7dd89c222041bffd53c131a deliberately changed the return
values of _get_capacity_info() within the NetApp drivers to return
a 2-tuple, based on API calls to obtain capacity information from
the NetApp storage arrays. That commit missed that this method
would also be invoked by the parent nfs class _is_share_eligible()
method, which expects a different signature.

The fix in this commit is to replace the call to the parent
_is_share_eligible() method with a more appropriate NetApp class
specific _share_has_space_for_clone() method.  This new method
uses the NetApp version of _get_capacity_info to get space information
from the arrays via NetApp apis and expects a 2-tuple to be returned
from this method.

Note that although this is a cherry-pick, changes were made
because NetApp Kilo drivers do not support scheduler-based
over-subscription, only the legacy driver-based NFS over-subscription
options.

    Conflicts:
        cinder/tests/test_netapp_nfs.py
        cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/test_nfs_base.py
        cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/test_nfs_cmode.py

Change-Id: Ib0c69e5ea7b32d17930fe0bdcdb9357fd4e4a244
Closes-bug: 1490845
(cherry picked from commit cc651ff8c658c4f8d4415d46a348136b653ab30a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-12 20:20:27.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_policy.py'], 'message': "Remove oslo.policy implementation tests from keystone

oslo.policy 0.12.0 contains a change to use requests to do the http
check rather than urllib. This change caused keystone tests to fail
because the keystone tests were mocking urllib, making assumptions
about how oslo.policy is implemented. Keystone doesn't need to test
internal features of oslo.policy, so these tests are removed.

Change-Id: I9d6e4950b9fe75cbb94100c8effdcec002642027
Closes-Bug: 1505374
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove oslo.policy implementation tests from keystone

oslo.policy 0.12.0 contains a change to use requests to do the http
check rather than urllib. This change caused keystone tests to fail
because the keystone tests were mocking urllib, making assumptions
about how oslo.policy is implemented. Keystone doesn't need to test
internal features of oslo.policy, so these tests are removed.

Change-Id: I9d6e4950b9fe75cbb94100c8effdcec002642027
Closes-Bug: 1505374

commit_message:
Specify default_domain to generic plugin

The generic plugin is supposed to work with both the v2 and v3 APIs.
This doesn't necessarily work because you either need to provide domain
information or not which implies specifying a v2 or v3 preference.

By adding default domain we can allow using v2 or v3 authentication
interchangeably. This is something that openstackclient does already.

Change-Id: I8d036a080a09b9310ffdd73d3501b6df29a212b9

This commit tests running an OpenStack service from a venv which
may or may not be running in a container. The change here was done
to allow for services that will have different deps in the future
to run side by side without the need to resolve deps down to a
single version that will satisfy all projects. While the package
resolution to a single version is still possible in the new big
tent and "simver" world its likely that this will become harder
sooner than later.

', 'number': 11}, {'created': '2015-09-22 04:29:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP] Run Cinder from a venv

This commit tests running an OpenStack service from a venv which
may or may not be running in a container. The change here was done
to allow for services that will have different deps in the future
to run side by side without the need to resolve deps down to a
single version that will satisfy all projects. While the package
resolution to a single version is still possible in the new big
tent and "simver" world its likely that this will become harder
sooner than later.

Change-Id: Icd764b78ee887f4fe2ecd4bb67b97ae4651e6fa3

commit_message:
Implement cinder venv support

This commit conditionally allows the os_cinder role to
install build and deploy within a venv. This is the new
default behavior of the role however the functionality
can be disabled.

Implements: blueprint enable-venv-support-within-the-roles

Change-Id: Icd764b78ee887f4fe2ecd4bb67b97ae4651e6fa3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Kill conntrackd state on HA routers FIP disassociation

Legacy routers kill conntrackd states on FIP disassociation,
so that traffic to FIPs that have been disassociated is properly
dropped. This is not the case with HA routers, and this patch
changes that.

Change-Id: Ic962c518ce33a4936d0f1655d60d308c5e776a9b
Closes-Bug: #1505700

commit_message:
Implement keystone venv support

This commit conditionally allows the os_keystone role to
install build and deploy within a venv. This is the new
default behavior of the role however the functionality
can be disabled.

Change-Id: Ie9e51926c96125a543e05eaa1912684fb01fecda
Implements: blueprint enable-venv-support-within-the-roles
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Archive Keystone to Keystone Federation rst content

This content will be used in a future release to
document Keystone to Keystone federation.
It includes mapping, SP setup, IdP setup, and
ADFS info.

Closes-bug: #1482781

Change-Id: Ia0509cd0f59da659e38db8fe55a19edc49b69b37
(cherry picked from commit bc074df9ca2d7c493ad2f8dac3ee4744de052c66)

Remove WebOb 1.5.0 cap

Remove the cap as the issue has been removed upstream. More details
are covered in the below-mentioned bug. This covers multiple
projects and patches, so I don't think it's appropriate to list
all the related upstream patches seeing as they're covered in the
bug.

Change-Id: I6931eb0459dd116027a9d0ae4c2b76d7d98c2d6b
Closes-Bug: #1505153

commit_message:
Implement glance venv support

This commit conditionally allows the os_glance role to
install build and deploy within a venv. This is the new
default behavior of the role however the functionality
can be disabled.

Change-Id: If58b1f2ebe15672602effe5c06c85524385562ba
Implements: blueprint enable-venv-support-within-the-roles
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Moving DLO functionality doc to the middleware code

This change moves the RST DLO documentation from
statically inside overview_large_objects.rst and moves it
to middleware/dlo.py.
This is where all middleware RST documentation is defined.

The overview_large_objects.rst is still the main page
for information on large objects, so now dynamically
points to both the DLO and SLO middleware RST
documentation and the relevant middleware.rst page
simply points to it.

Change-Id: I40d918c8b7bc608ab945805d69fe359521df038a
Closes-bug: #1276852

commit_message:
Remove migrated service clients from test_service_client

As many service client have been migrated to Tempest-lib (0.10.0),
we can remove those service clients testing in test_service_client tests.

The main purpose of this test was for checking all parameters' values are
passed to RestClient via ServiceClient.

Now service clients in Tempest-lib directly inherited from RestClient
instead of ServiceClient.

Only service clients which are already migrated to lib are being removed
from this tests.

Change-Id: Ie4ed03ee4c8fd42d945da80b1c45d80cbec97b5c

commit_message:
Use Tempest-lib's compute extensions_client

Compute extensions_client has been migrated to tempest-lib-
Ic658f09649ed9498fe6d3e7792a7c370772f165b

Now Tempest-lib provides this client as stable interface so Tempest
should start using this from lib and remove its own copy.
Also remove other files for this client like response schema, unit tests.

This commits makes Tempest to use compute extensions_client
from Tempest-lib.

Change-Id: Iafc7e505b534df897b0c321b40b3b4734f6aa833

I225569ddb2c56200cf071e7abd017ce183fd161f

commit_message:
Fixing checking bytecode.

We have a plan to migrate service clients to tempest-lib from Tempest.
However, we are not doing enough tests for service clients now.
This patch fixes checking bytecode.

Change-Id: I801973a193e8e786b93ee50983970bfd3230235d

subject: Remove ceilometer specific config for grenade plugin
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-23 16:44:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove ceilometer specific config for grenade plugin

Ceilometer services are now enabled and controlled via a plugin
with this change Ie3219a41a3d371d9ac21552e3d8b15775ea696f6. This
means we can remove all ceilometer specific manual config entries

commit_message:
Remove ceilometer specific config for grenade plugin

Ceilometer services are now enabled and controlled via a plugin
with this change Ie3219a41a3d371d9ac21552e3d8b15775ea696f6. This
means we can remove all ceilometer specific manual config entries
in the grenade plugin.

Related-Bug: #1489436

Change-Id: I2fbff1fed38ac8acc8a7950024714abea049aeb8

commit_message:
Use Tempest-lib's compute baremetal_nodes_client

Compute baremetal_nodes_client has been migrated to tempest-lib-
I528505bdd0a51cf720578dc6c5ef4301b72b5ce0

Now Tempest-lib provides this client as stable interface so Tempest
should start using this from lib and remove its own copy.
Also remove other files for this client like response schema, unit tests.

This commits makes Tempest to use compute baremetal_nodes_client
from Tempest-lib.

Change-Id: I2bcfcb9df21d3dfa3c0f511f46006032c0ea632b

commit_message:
Remove functions: _cleanse_dict & format_message

The functions _cleanse_dict & format_message are not used.

_cleanse_dict was used previously by another function that was removed
because it was unused.

format_message usage has been removed as the correct way to get a
message from an exception is six.text_type(exception). Remove it to
prevent people from trying to use it.

Closes-Bug: #1505080
Change-Id: I1a1284b0526787a62b6765bf2e3547dbba822352
Depends-On: I75757b5bd7d9e75ca37d1b9a1efff810ba84b5df

commit_message:
Sync deployment tasks on fuel-library upgrade

Simple yum update could break redeployments because
a given task could be changed or deleted. Therefore,
an attempt or warning should be made to update
deployment tasks.

Added explicit dependency on fuelclient.

Change-Id: I76efd12e1262bc281856f0e927cdf2668f2ce532
Cherry-Picked-From: I06a905aa0bbaefbeb7cbdc60b563f11575bd5bd8
Closes-Bug: #1475530

commit_message:
Remove /openstackgit from repo_mirror_excludes

In kilo, repo-install.yml still defaults to using repo-clone-mirror.yml
however it has an exclude on /openstackgit.  We need to sync
/openstackgit as novnc and spice-html5 are installed by cloning the
repos from the repo server.

Closes-Bug: #1505978

Change-Id: Ib217670566d400521f9acb8b26c387ed71863bb2

Add a table showing all the openstack plugin objects

We need a spot that highlights the `objects` used by OpenStack
based `plugins`. The sooner we have this information out, the
sooner we reduce the chance of a name collision.

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-21 12:46:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Support SMI-S provider v8.0.3 in VMAX driver

This patch made changes in the VMAX driver to support
interface changes in SMI-S provider v8.0.3.

* Accommodate System Name prefix change from 'SYMMETRIX+' to
  'SYMMETRIX-+-'.
* Delete composite volume - changed from using
  ReturnElementsToStoragePool to EMCReturnToStoragePool.
* Extend volume - removed InPool parameter from EMCUnBindElements
  method.
* Create snapshot/clone with multi meta members -
  EMC_PartialAllocOfConcreteExtentCIM was deprecated;
  used 'GetCompositeElements' instead and changed how we get meta
  members' capacities.
* Create CG snapshot - A new WaitForCopyState parameter was added.
* Added helper function to determine SMI-S provider and SE version
  Note: SMI-S provider is bundled with SE (Solutions Enabler) and
  they have the same version number starting from v8.0.
  The EMC SMI-S Provider supports the SNIA Storage Management Initiative
  (SMI), an ANSI standard for storage management. It supports the VMAX
  storage system. SE is a software product that discovers and manages
  VMAX storage system.

Conflicts:
        cinder/tests/test_emc_vmax.py
        cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vmax_fc.py
        cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vmax_iscsi.py
        cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vmax_utils.py

Closes-Bug: #1463217
Change-Id: Ia6333396a8111f110f540c367e5018cfad6e93e4
(cherry picked from commit f6d5eb70a9b0b5accf3689270a5325975ab5a9cb)

commit_message:
Support SMI-S provider v8.0.3 in VMAX driver

This patch made changes in the VMAX driver to support
interface changes in SMI-S provider v8.0.3.

* Accommodate System Name prefix change from 'SYMMETRIX+' to
  'SYMMETRIX-+-'.
* Delete composite volume - changed from using
  ReturnElementsToStoragePool to EMCReturnToStoragePool.
* Extend volume - removed InPool parameter from EMCUnBindElements
  method.
* Create snapshot/clone with multi meta members -
  EMC_PartialAllocOfConcreteExtentCIM was deprecated;
  used 'GetCompositeElements' instead and changed how we get meta
  members' capacities.
* Create CG snapshot - A new WaitForCopyState parameter was added.
* Added helper function to determine SMI-S provider and SE version
  Note: SMI-S provider is bundled with SE (Solutions Enabler) and
  they have the same version number starting from v8.0.
  The EMC SMI-S Provider supports the SNIA Storage Management Initiative
  (SMI), an ANSI standard for storage management. It supports the VMAX
  storage system. SE is a software product that discovers and manages
  VMAX storage system.

Conflicts:
        cinder/tests/test_emc_vmax.py
        cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vmax_fc.py
        cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vmax_iscsi.py
        cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vmax_utils.py

Closes-Bug: #1463217
Change-Id: Ia6333396a8111f110f540c367e5018cfad6e93e4
(cherry picked from commit f6d5eb70a9b0b5accf3689270a5325975ab5a9cb)

commit_message:
Fix up object-store show commands

1) Change metadata to appear under a common 'properties' key, and
use the utility to format them, this applied to object, account
and container.

2) Clean up container and object output, which were setting the
x-container-meta-owner property, but this is metadata only for
the container, so it's pointless to have, removed it.

3) Container show was showing read/write ACLs and sync stuff, but
these are not being returned by my swift by default, so I moved
these to be checks, so we don't clutter the output.

Change-Id: Ife7521fe9c2724035b06963c118bd6016ba2f5b5

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary fabric mapping on mgmt node

In npiv.py we check to see if the fabric mapping is the first mapping.
If it is, we save this to the management partition first as this could
have been a deploy. In the cases where it is a volume attach, this is
an unnecessary step since we can map directly to the VM in most cases.
The change here is in wwpns where we first check if it is the initial
mapping but also check if we can modify I/O. If this checks out, we
map directly to the VM.

Change-Id: If1452cc93b5e60309137190b42d10320a55fb594
Closes-Bug: #1491528

commit_message:
Provide better debug log when 'cinder manage' fails

Change this DEBUG log message from:

  Updating volume: 7fd9a82d-0f11-4d1b-921d-97186a4e2df4 with
  {'status': 'error'} due to: ???

to:

  Updating volume: 7fd9a82d-0f11-4d1b-921d-97186a4e2df4 with
  {'status': 'error'} due to: Volume create failed while
  extracting volume ref.

When a volume manage operation fails here.

The subsequent ERROR log message remains as:
  "Volume <id>: create failed"

Change-Id: I70c343a974926348f5e3b7e0fffbd0b976bc96a2

subject: Fix boot.ipxe config behavior to ensure proper use
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-09 12:57:35.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/ironic_config.yml', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/README.md', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/create_tftpboot.yml'], 'message': "Fix boot.ipxe config behavior to ensure proper use

By default, on each deploy, ironic will replace the boot.ipxe file,
that a node will normally utilize to boot with the base template from
ironic. While this is good for the largely generic use case, bifrost
users have encountered various issues utilizing iPXE with different
components that we've incorporated support for.

As such, we will set the ironic config so that our template is
utilized.  Additionally updated the role README to inform and
direct users of this to file bugs if issues are encountered.

Change-Id: I8f47f4573dcf2346b4c5d424df5aabe62ebafa94
Closes-Bug: # 1504533
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix boot.ipxe config behavior to ensure proper use

By default, on each deploy, ironic will replace the boot.ipxe file,
that a node will normally utilize to boot with the base template from
ironic. While this is good for the largely generic use case, bifrost
users have encountered various issues utilizing iPXE with different
components that we've incorporated support for.

As such, we will set the ironic config so that our template is
utilized.  Additionally updated the role README to inform and
direct users of this to file bugs if issues are encountered.

Change-Id: I8f47f4573dcf2346b4c5d424df5aabe62ebafa94
Closes-Bug: # 1504533

commit_message:
Encrypt default hidden parameters correctly

1. Default values of parameters are not guaranteed to be strings
which causes encryption to fail. Add methods to parameter classes
to allow fetching their string representation.

2. Encrypt the hidden parameters that are used for stack creation.
This includes default values for hidden parameters in templates.

Change-Id: Id8c758806a046f563ae0386c75cdd89fb05c38e3
Closes-Bug: #1488679

commit_message:
Add test for cobbler refresh nodes
This patch addes check for related bug to system tests

Test steps:
1. Create env with 1Controller, 1Compute, 1Ceph
2. Start provisioning
3. Backup master
4. Reset env
5. Restore master
6. Delete env
7. Create new env via CLI with the same staff
8. Start provisioning via CLI

Change-Id: If01f320f54df21505663540cffa663e6a7a432f1
Closes-Bug: 1503243
Related-Bug: 1460166

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-10 20:14:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Update rhel7 element readme

Evidently the readme file hasn't been updated since rhel7 finished
beta, so this is long overdue.

In addition, since it's not possible to download the base image
file directly, let's stop pretending we can and replace the default
file name with a pointer to the readme, which now contains details
on how to download and use an image from the customer portal.  This
is also how the rhel element is documented to work, so it makes
sense to have the same thing here.

Change-Id: Ie8343ee2ce1715583c28de7f59daed7e58c8ca0f
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-10 20:20:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Update rhel7 element readme

In addition, since it's not possible to download the base image
file directly, let's stop pretending we can and replace the default
file name with a pointer to the readme, which now contains details
on how to download and use an image from the customer portal.  This

Change-Id: Ie8343ee2ce1715583c28de7f59daed7e58c8ca0f
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-09-17 19:52:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Update rhel7 element readme

Evidently the readme file hasn't been updated since rhel7 finished
beta, so this is long overdue.

In addition, since it's not possible to download the base image
file directly, let's stop pretending we can and replace the default
file name with a pointer to the readme, which now contains details
on how to download and use an image from the customer portal.  This
is also how the rhel element is documented to work, so it makes
sense to have the same thing here.

This change also alters the default value for BASE_IMAGE_FILE
(which is only used when DIB_LOCAL_IMAGE is not set) to be essentially
a help message pointing users to the README if they failed to set
DIB_LOCAL_IMAGE before building.

Change-Id: Ie8343ee2ce1715583c28de7f59daed7e58c8ca0f

file directly, let's stop pretending we can and bail out if the user

commit_message:
Update rhel7 element readme

Evidently the readme file hasn't been updated since rhel7 finished
beta, so this is long overdue.

In addition, since it's not possible to download the base image
file directly, let's stop pretending we can and bail out if the user
didn't set the necessary env vars.

Also updated the README to use the new table format instead of free text

Co-Authored-By: Augustina Ragwitz <aragwitz+lp@pobox.com>
Change-Id: Ie8343ee2ce1715583c28de7f59daed7e58c8ca0f

commit_message:
Fix heat polling error

Currently, while polling heat driver, return value of stacks and
deployments from heat driver are Objects of Stack and
SoftwareDeployment respectively. But the translator selector type
used is DICT instead of DOT, hence causing error.
This commit addresses the same.

Change-Id: I28648d9e73ead10467e5969dfb5e2a23e7278d12
Closes-Bug:#1503447

commit_message:
Update LOG level for some messages

Currently, API request is not logged when debug is set to False.
So, could not track the API requests issued. This commit updates the
log level to INFO for API requests.


Change-Id: Ic07de1e134fd8c19b27f160dfd4c32a80d094ab2

commit_message:
Remove shared=False from get_internal_network

It turns out internal networks can be shared (as in BlueBox) Removing
the shared=False from the internal network search produces correct
results.

Change-Id: I40ba45d8fc78a0d10a44503ed5b7daf91924e441

commit_message:
Use standard locale when executing 'parted' command

Not only 'dd' command but also 'parted' makes iscsi deploy fail in
Japanese environment. This patch applies the same fix as 'dd'.

 ironic.drivers.modules.iscsi_deploy [-] Deploy failed for instance
 <uuid>. Error: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xe8 in position 20:
 ordinal not in range(128)

Change-Id: If6c3fbd08ff380470d88b16605b44eb00c271352
Related-Bug: #1488289
(cherry picked from commit da5ddf4e703b6de9ef67420a0eb4baaa740980d7)

commit_message:
Revert "virt: Use preexec_fn to ulimit qemu-img info call"

This reverts commit da217205f53f9a38a573fb151898fbbeae41021d.

The patch made nova-compute to segfault, among other things
resulting in instances not being spawned successfully.

Closes-Bug: #1506012
Change-Id: I0065dd194a7c910cc9f9d9b468e5d43bf5c9b7c0
